alert.note: Alert for Concho; Menard; Schleicher; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 11:18PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Schleicher, southeastern Tom Green, northwestern Menard and southern Concho Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381 to 9 miles east of Christoval to near The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1828 And Ranch Road 915. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Eldorado, Christoval, Eden, Wall, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Mereta, Veribest, Knickerbocker, Vancourt, Lake Nasworthy, Eola, Live Oak, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1828 And Ranch Road 915, The Intersection Of Us- 87 And Ranch Road 2134, Adams, Vick and The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 2084. People near Test event at NWS-SJT should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
